bug.author: MarkTension
bug.summary: No "Scripting Runtime Version" in Unity's "Other Settings" menu?
bug.description:
Describe the bug In the <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Unity-Technologies/ml-agents/blob/master/docs/Basic-Guide.md>basic guide</denchmark-link> , step 5 .ii the instruction is to: Select Scripting Runtime Version to Experimental (.NET 4.6 Equivalent or .NET 4.x Equivalent) However, I don't see the Scripting Runtime Version in my Project settings. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16321685/64488379-8c4edb80-d247-11e9-9a7f-c88e6feb53b2.png></denchmark-link>
To Reproduce In Unity, Go to Edit > Project Settings > Player For each of the platforms you target (PC, Mac and Linux Standalone, iOS or Android): Expand the Other Settings section. Select Scripting Runtime Version to Experimental (.NET 4.6 Equivalent or .NET 4.x Equivalent) Environment (please complete the following information):
MacOS Mojave, Unity Version 2019.2.4f1 Personal ML-Agents version: latest branch from source
Thanks for the help!

comments.comment:
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/MarkTension>@MarkTension</denchmark-link>
It looks like some of the Player settings have changed since that part of the documentation was written (That settings appears in the 2019.1 documentation <denchmark-link:https://docs.unity3d.com/2019.1/Documentation/Manual/class-PlayerSettingsStandalone.html>https://docs.unity3d.com/2019.1/Documentation/Manual/class-PlayerSettingsStandalone.html</denchmark-link> but was apparently removed in 2019.2). You should be fine ignoring that setting for now; we'll update the documentation to be clearer.
I've added a request to update the documentation around this to our internal tracker with the ID MLA-18. I’m going to close this issue for now, but we’ll ping back with any updates
